title: News View :: The World On Arirang
text: The director of the U.S. Missile Defense Agency has expressed hope South Korea and Japan will be able to resolve their differences over Seoul's recent termination of a military information sharing pact with Tokyo.Speaking at the Center for Strategic and International Studies in Washington on Monday, Vice Admiral Jon Hill stressed the importance of allies sharing military information with each other.Asked whether the three countries could continue to share military information in the future, Hill said it was possible, adding it's crucial in defending against possible ballistic missile attacks.
description: 한국을 대표하는 글로벌 방송! The World On Arirang!
